main event: Several persons, probably originating in Kerrville, Texas, reported the observation of an unidentified flying object on October 8, 1950.
interesting points: The report of this sighting was made to the military and was considered to be of little value for analysis.
The limited information given indicated the object viewed was probably a distant light or reflection of some terrestrial source.
A similar sighting was reported on October 7, 1960, where an illuminated object passed over a witness's house at a rapid rate of speed.
On October 23, 1960, seven persons observed an unusual light in the sky near Kerrville, Texas, but no further investigation was deemed justified.
Several persons reported seeing similar objects on other occasions, but the October 7, 1960 sighting was the first time the witness was able to get a good look at one.
sighted object: glowing, round object approximately 50 feet in diameter
witnesses: several civilians, including students and a captain in the USAF
